article.headline: Dayton 90, Pepperdine 77
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Ramod Marshall scored 21 points and Sean Finn added 19 to lead Dayton to a 90-77 victory against Pepperdine Friday night. The Flyers (1-0) gave Brian Gregory a victory in his first game as a head coach. Gregory had been associate head coach at Michigan State the past three seasons. Pepperdine (0-1) trailed by as many as 16 after missing 10 of its first 11 field goal attempts, but narrowed the deficit to 65-61 on a 3-pointer from Terrance Johnson with 5:24 to play. Marshall then scored five points during a 7-0 run that made it 72-61 with 3:26 remaining. Dayton secured the victory by making 18 of 20 free throws in the final 2:12. Johnson and Glen McGowan scored 26 points apiece for the Waves. It was career high for Johnson, and tied a career high for McGowan.
